p: Figure 4a shows the FTIR spectra of pure PS and PS/CNT nanofibers. The characteristic broad peaks at 700, 755, 1456, 1494, 2928 and 3023 cm −1 could be ascribed to the various absorption bands of PS [ 43]. The absorption intensities at 3023 and 2928 cm −1 correspond to the C–H symmetric and asymmetric vibrations, respectively. The peaks at 1456 and 1494 cm −1 were assigned to bending vibrations and the stronger peaks at 700 and 755 cm −1 correspond to the mono-substituted benzene. With an increase in CNT concentration, the characteristic bands of PS strengthen due to better reinforcement [ 44]. The absence of additional peaks indicates the absence of any chemical reaction or formation of chemical bonds during electrospinning. This illustrates the physical blending of PS and CNT.
